About Me

My developer journey...

I have always enjoyed solving problems. Early on, I helped solved operational/technical issues for 12 years within the hospitality/technical support industry. At 30, I found out I was going to be a father. After contemplating what I wanted to do, I decided I wanted to be a web developer. So in 2015, I jumped into Free Code Camp and started my journey to break into tech.

I am a proactive software engineer with 4+ years of experience using JavaScript (ES6, Vue.js). I also have a passion for responsive web design using CSS, SCSS, and improving web accessibility. I am seeking companies/projects who wants someone who is enthusiastic about user-centric UI/UX and fostering growth.

I am currently exploring the Southwestern United States with my wife and kids in a 19-foot travel trailer. In my free time, you can find me walking/hiking and exploring new towns with my family to find the best tourist traps/local food.
